review: Oh how we love our Chromecast!We actually owned our Chromecast for over a year before we were able to use it as our laptop could not send quality pictures to our television. If we were even able to cast from the computer, it was choppy and could not keep up.As soon as we replaced the computer we immediately tried our Chromecast. It worked perfectly!We immediately cancelled our cable. I was scared to not have a DVR, thinking that I would miss it. I have never once missed my DVR!We are able to watch every television we were watching on cable! We have a subscription to Netflix and are contemplating a subscription to Hulu Plus. But as of yet we have not found a television show that we wanted but were unable to watch.If you have a computer with a good processor, buy a Chromecast! We love it more everyday!

review: The Chromecast does what it claims to do - allows very simple streaming of content from all my devices. I have a 46" monitor on my office wall, and I use the chromecast for meetings. While sitting at my desk, I can just 'cast' a tab from my Chrome browser up onto the screen for a presentation, or to collaborate with others. I wanted to use it for digital signage also, but the downside is that the host device or computer must be actively streaming. It would be really nice if I could set it to stream directly from a website, so that the computer wouldn't have to be on. But... no one ever promised me that functionality, so although I'm a little disappointed, it does do what it claims, and does it well
author: Brad Clayton
